_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The four incredible and amazing things a: An assembly of aristocrats is uplifted by seeing him and uplifted by hearing him speak. And when he falls silent, they’ve never had enough.
An assembly of brahmins is uplifted by seeing him and uplifted by hearing him speak. And when he falls silent, they’ve never had enough.
An assembly of householders is uplifted by seeing him and uplifted by hearing him speak. And when he falls silent, they’ve never had enough.
An assembly of ascetics is uplifted by seeing him and uplifted by hearing him speak. And when he falls silent, they’ve never had enough.
An assembly of monks is uplifted by seeing him and uplifted by hearing him speak. And when he falls silent, they’ve never had enough.
An assembly of nuns is uplifted by seeing him and uplifted by hearing him speak. And when he falls silent, they’ve never had enough.
An assembly of laymen is uplifted by seeing him and uplifted by hearing him speak. And when he falls silent, they’ve never had enough.
An assembly of laywomen is uplifted by seeing him and uplifted by hearing him speak. And when he falls silent, they’ve never had enough.
